intro: Vinkia, commonly known as the "false violets," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Violaceae. Vinkia species typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest floors. Their botanical features include erect or spreading stems and small, clustered inflorescences.
